title: Poch after loss: Wearing U.S. shirt 'not enough'
content: Mauricio Pochettino was left visibly frustrated after the USMNT's shock 1-0 defeat to Panama in the Concacaf Nations League, bluntly telling his players it was not enough to just simply show up in the national team shirt and expect to win.

title: 11-seed Drake holds off Mizzou rally for upset
content: Drake, a No. 11 seed relying heavily on D-II transfers, had a 15-point lead whittled to one with 4:28 left but held off Missouri to advance in the NCAA tournament.

title: McNeese scripts 'biggest day' in upset of Clemson
content: McNeese coach Will Wade and his boom box-toting manager are moving on in March Madness after the 12th-seeded Cowboys held off No. 5 seed Clemson on Thursday in the first bracket buster of the NCAA tournament.

title: Ovechkin nets No. 888, Caps clinch playoff berth
content: Alex Ovechkin scored his 888th career goal Thursday to move seven away from breaking Wayne Gretzky's NHL career record.

title: Ex-U-M assistant charged with computer hacking
content: A former NFL and University of Michigan assistant football coach hacked into the computer accounts of thousands of college athletes seeking intimate photos and videos, according to an indictment filed Thursday.

title: Source: DE Omenihu gets 1-year deal with Chiefs
content: Defensive end Charles Omenihu is returning to the Kansas City Chiefs on a one-year deal worth a maximum of $7 million, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Celtics sold for record $6.1 billion, sources say
content: Bill Chisholm has agreed to purchase the Boston Celtics from the Grousbeck family for a valuation for $6.1 billion, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: U.S. billionaire eyes Houston NHL team
content: American billionaire Dan Friedkin has emerged as a strong ownership option to bring the NHL to Houston, sources told ESPN.

title: USMNT loses to Panama again in worst performance of Pochettino era
content: Panama made it three straight victories over the U.S. in tournament play as Mauricio Pochettino's side slumped to a 1-0 defeat in the Concacaf Nations League semifinal that showed the Americans at their worst.

title: Debating free agency: Which teams improved the most over the past two weeks?
content: We asked 10 experts to weigh in on the most improved teams, top bargains and head-scratching decisions.

title: The blessing and curse of UCLA's Lauren Betts' 6-7 height
content: Lauren Betts was called an alien, a giraffe. Now she's ready to dominate -- not for the bullies, for herself -- as UCLA goes for its first NCAA title.

title: Next stop, Tampa: Experts predict women's Final Four and 2025 national champion
content: Which team will cut down the nets in Tampa? ESPN's experts pick the Final Four, the title game matchup and 2025 champion.

title: Short an ace? In a loaded AL East? Here's why the Orioles think they can win anyway
content: Their window is wide-open, but they're 0-5 in October the past two seasons. Are they wasting an opportunity -- or is this their year?

title: What to watch for in March internationals: Tuchel's England debut, Ronaldo goals, Poch's first big U.S. test
content: It's the first internationals of the year! There's lots happening as World Cup qualifying ramps up and European teams face off in the Nations League.

title: Chelsea ink Sporting pair, deals worth up to $80M
content: Chelsea have reached an agreement to sign Sporting Lisbon's Geovany Quenda and Dario Essugo in a joint deal worth up to €74.4 million ($81.15 million), the Portuguese side confirmed on Wednesday.

title: Japan become 1st side to qualify for '26 World Cup
content: Japan beat Bahrain 2-0 in Saitama on Thursday to become the first team to qualify for the 2026 World Cup.

title: Tuchel: England were afraid to lose at Euro 2024
content: Thomas Tuchel has said he believes England struggled to produce consistent performances at Euro 2024 as the players were more afraid of being knocked out of the tournament than they were focused to win it.

title: Barcelona to finish season at Olympic Stadium
content: Barcelona on Thursday informed its fans that the club will finish the season at Olympic Stadium where they will play all remaining LaLiga and Champions League matches as construction at Spotify Camp Nou continues to be delayed.

title: Andy Robertson: Liverpool career far from over
content: Andrew Robertson has brushed off criticism of his Liverpool performances this season and insisted that his time at Anfield is not coming to an end.

title: Ex-Utd defender Jones 'embarrassed' by injuries
content: Former Manchester United defender Phil Jones has said he was "embarrassed" by the injuries that blighted his Old Trafford career.

title: New women's 7 vs. 7 league touting $5M purses
content: A new global 7-on-7 women's soccer event is set to launch ahead of the UEFA Women's Champions League final in May with the promise of a $5 million prize pool per event.

title: McKennie: U.S. needs 'nastiness' in CNL defense
content: United States midfielder Weston McKennie said it's "about time" that the U.S. brings some "nastiness" to its game ahead of Thursday's Concacaf Nations League semifinal against Panama.

title: Scheffler stays true to roots with Masters menu
content: From cowboy ribeye to chili, the Texas native and two-time Augusta winner left his mark for the champions dinner.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Edwards' path to victory at UFC Fight Night
content: Who has the edge in Saturday's UFC Fight Night from London? An MMA fighter and betting insider make their picks.

title: NCAA Wrestling Championships: Schedule, rules, scoring, stats
content: The NCAA men's Division I wrestling championships start Thursday; here's how to watch Penn State, Iowa and more.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool set to rival Real Madrid for teen Dean Huijsen
content: Liverpool look set to rival Real Madrid for Bournemouth's Dean Huijsen. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Minor survivor in Tangra mass murders awaits guardian a month after the tragedy
content: Reports suggest that multiple non-related families have volunteered to take the boy, but no concrete plan for his future has been chalked out

title: A classic for the ages | Review of Perumal Murugan and Appupen’s graphic novel adaptation of C.S. Chellappa’s Vaadivaasal
content: Murugan’s minimalistic text and Appupen’s striking sketches bring to life the 1949 jallikattu novel, a meditation on masculinity and caste hierarchies

title: 'Papa is in the drum': Meerut victim's mother claims her 6-year-old granddaughter as saying
content: The deceased's family has alleged that the parents of the accused wife, Muskan Rastogi, were aware of Saurabh's murder well before March 18, when the police were officially informed about the crime

title: Flavours of Ramzan across Karnataka
content: During the month of Ramzan, many parts of Bengaluru transform into hub of culinary delights in the evenings, offering residents and visitors an array of delectable Iftar options

title: Pedestrians edged out as motorists invade pavements in Bengaluru
content: In January and February this year, the Bengaluru Traffic Police has fined 3,453 motorists for riding on pavements with an average of 57 violations per day. Hundreds go unchecked as riding on pavements is becoming almost accepted behaviour

title: When genes wield a sickle
content: Sickle Cell Anaemia, a severe genetic blood disorder, has been crushing many tribal families in Alluri Sitharama Raju district. Patients suffer immense trauma and, sometimes, early death, while treatment costs push their families deeper into poverty. Currently, over 1,300 people live with this condition, many of them children, finds Harish Gilai

title: How do habitual offender laws discriminate? | Explained
content: How are habitual offenders deemed so? What is the history behind denotified and nomadic tribes being seen as ‘criminal tribes’? Why are States such as Gujarat not keen to repeal the habitual offender laws?

title: A cultural feast brings down curtains on sports meet
content: Talking about the sports meet held on March 18 and 19, the Chief Minister said if MLAs and MLCs enthusiastically participated in such programmes, there would not be any need for them to worry about their health

title: Silent shutdown of rural futures in Telangana
content: Fate of the 65-year-old National Institute of Rural Development and Panchayat Raj on the outskirts of Hyderabad hangs in the balance after the Centre announced its disengagement and halted grants, leaving over 600 staff and their families in a limbo. Ravi Reddy examines the abrupt funding cut and potential dismantling of an institution that has transformed thousands of lives through its rural employment and development programmes

title: Chief Proctor of college in Hathras arrested for 'sexually exploiting' college students
content: The police said they have also recovered a mobile phone and a laptop from Kumar, who was a professor in the Geography Department of the Bagla Degree College and rose to become the Chief Proctor.

title: With over 500 cases in every district, Kerala’s drug menace is widespread and escalating
content: In 2022, every district in Kerala recorded at least 500 cases under the Narcotics Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act. This was not seen in any other State.

title: Red hot Byadgi chilli stings farmers as prices fall
content: Byadgi chillies are a must in every kitchen for their special colour and flavour. But the growers of this variety in several parts of north Karnataka are in distress as prices are plummeting. Girish Pattanashetti travelled to the chilli market in Byadgi in Haveri district to talk to the farmers

title: India a stabilising factor in the Arctic, says Russian Ambassador
content: Russia is in favour of expanding its cooperation with India on scientific and commercial fields in the Arctic, as NATO countries allegedly generate tensions in the region.

title: U.S. judge blocks expulsion of Indian scholar detained over ‘Hamas ties’
content: U.S. District Judge Patricia Tolliver Giles in Alexandria, Virginia, ordered that Badar Khan Suri ‘shall not be removed from the United States unless and until the Court issues a contrary order’

title: CM announces extension of power amnesty scheme for domestic consumers in J&K
content: This marks the third time in the last three years that the J&K government has introduced the power amnesty scheme for domestic consumers

title: Gurugram DM orders evacuation of unsafe towers in Chintels Paradiso housing society
content: Move comes after the towers of the flat were declared unsafe in the structural audit report; residents’ welfare association says order was invoked without proper planning

title: Chennai Metro Rail Limited conducts its first trial run on Phase II network amid a few technical glitches
content: The train departed Poonamallee Depot around 11.30 p.m. after initial delays. It was operated for a distance of 3 km and reached Mullaithottam around 11.45 p.m. The trials are likely to be held daily

title: Manipur’s long road to recovery
content: President’s Rule was imposed in Manipur on February 13, 2025, after 21 months of violence and arson, fuelled by tensions between the Kuki-Zo tribes and the Meitei community, leaving 62,000 people displaced. With trade, health care, and education hit, and businesses facing extortion and reduced demand, the Centre now has a 13-point agenda to restore stability. Vijaita Singh finds that many on both sides of the ethnic divide, however, long for peace

title: AIADMK files a review petition against order passed in case for freezing ‘two leaves’ symbol
content: Justices R. Subramanian and C. Kumarappan condone the delay of six days in filing the review plea and decide to hear the review after it gets numbered

title: CM Mamata sets up collective leadership of party functionaries, Ministers to keep a vigil during her U.K. visit
content: Mamata Banerjee will be on a seven-day visit to the U.K. starting March 22. She has nominated the party’s State’s president Subrata Bakshi and Trinamool national general secretary Abhishek Banerjee to look at the affairs of the party during her absence

title: Supreme Court Collegium proposes transfer of Orissa High Court Acting Chief Justice to Allahabad High Court
content: Justice Arindam Sinha has served as the Orissa HC’s Acting Chief Justice following the superannuation of its former Chief Justice Chakradhari Sharan Singh on January 19, 2025

title: Sweden’s AP Pension fund exits Bharat Electronics Limited over Myanmar military sale reports
content: The Ethics Council of Sweden’s AP Pension says BEL’s arms exports to the Myanmar military are “believed to contribute to the latter’s ability to commit violence against the country’s civilian population”

title: UPS: PFRDA notifies assured pension scheme for government employees
content: The regulations shall come into effect from April 1, the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority said in a statement

title: TN should focus on people’s welfare rather than sending teams on delimitation: Tamilisai
content: The DMK government has failed in all aspects of governance including maintaining law and order, says Tamilisai

title: Drug seizure from Kerala hostel: a wake-up call for campuses
content: The seizure of commercial quantities of cannabis from a college hostel has served as a wake-up call to Kerala society on the grave issue of substance abuse among students of the State. M.P. Praveen looks into the gravity and the extent of the drug menace on campuses

title: Issues faced by democracies in South Asia discussed at international meet hosted by SRM University-A.P.
content: Conference, organised under the aegis of the Department of Political Science, Easwari School of Liberal Arts, explored the concept of democracy and its relevance to the current political landscape in South Asia

title: ED conducts searches across four States in SDPI case
content: Enforcement Directorate conducts searches in 4 states linked to money-laundering involving Social Democratic Party of India and Popular Front of India, seizing assets worth ₹61.72 crore

title: Health secretaries demand reduction of workload
content: While there are around 18,000 ANMs in the State, around 13,500, fall under the purview of the village and ward secretariats and are called health secretaries, and the remaining fall under the purview of Medical and Health Department

title: State schools to have lesson-based assessment, evaluation through app
content: Students from Classes 1 to 10 will be tested after completing each lesson at the school level to help assess learning outcomes

title: India, Brazil could play a key role in shaping climate talks: COP30 President-Designate
content: The U.S.’s exit from the Paris Agreement did not imply that Americans as a whole had abandoned the challenge of addressing warming, Andre Lago said

title: TGSPDCL secures 3rd rank in DUR-CSRD ratings
content: Telangana’s TGSPDCL ranks third in the Distribution Utilities Ranking 2023-24, excelling in consumer services and power reliability

title: Land acquired for public purposes cannot be returned to owner by beneficiary through private deal: Supreme Court
content: Govt. had acquired 33 acres for setting up a grain market in Narela, but Delhi Agricultural Marketing Board agreed to transfer half of the total land back to the owner

title: Supreme Court action sought against Allahabad High Court judge who sparked public outrage in ‘attempt to rape’ case
content: Judge had downgraded the charges against the accused who allegedly grabbed a child’s breasts and broke her pyjama strings; senior lawyers, BJP and Congress leaders among those demanding action

title: 25 Indians awarded death sentence in UAE, judgement yet to be implemented: Centre
content: The number of Indians executed or given capital punishment in Kuwait and Saudi Arabia in 2024 stood at three each, while the corresponding figure for Zimbabwe was one

title: National interest paramount in India's decisions on international oil purchases: Centre
content: A 60-day “winding down period” was also announced after which the U.S. was supposed to designate all those that continue to deal with sanctioned parties in Russia’s energy sector

title: KTR declares 2025 as ‘year of struggle,’ plans statewide padayatra
content: Addressing the BRS workers meet, KTR held Chief Minister A. Revanth Reddy responsible for the drought conditions and water crisis at several places in the state

title: Rahul Gandhi says it’s ‘anti-national’ not to support caste census
content: Congress leader interacts with UGC Chairman, coinciding with the 98th anniversary of the Mahad Satyagraha of B.R. Ambedkar and emphasised importance of social justice

title: Opposition alleges ₹7,500-crore scam in awarding contract for procuring smart electricity meters
content: Govt. accused of awarding contract to a supplier rather than manufacturer, resulting in the meter cost going up

title: Farm leaders go on fast in custody; Samyukt Kisan Morcha groups say AAP, BJP stand for corporate interests
content: Samyukt Kisan Morcha-Non Political and the Kisan Mazdoor Morcha said in joint statement that the Punjab government had stabbed farmers in the back by arresting farmer leaders who were invited for a meeting

title: MHA reviews AFSPA in the Northeast, Army wants more areas in Manipur under Act
content: Final decision to be taken by the MHA; the Army proposed that 12 police station limits in valley districts be brought under the AFSPA for operational efficiency, say officials

title: Telangana gears up for Saraswati Pushkaralu 2025 with New App
content: A mobile app and improved amenities are planned for the Saraswati Pushkaralu festival at Kaleshwaram from May 15-26, 2025

title: PAC members flag failure of Swadesh Darshan scheme
content: As many as 76 projects were sanctioned under the scheme between 2014-15 and 2018-19 for ₹5,292.57 crore; panel says it is dissatisfied by the Tourism Ministry’s response to its review of the CAG report on the scheme

title: Union Minister’s nephew killed in gunfight with brother over drawing tap water in Bihar
content: Gun-battle erupts over tap water dispute in Bihar village, leaving Union Minister Nityananda Rai’s nephew dead and two injured

title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar caught laughing and talking during national anthem
content: RJD leaders slam Mr. Kumar’s behaviour as insulting and disrespectful to the national anthem and to the people of Bihar, questioning the CM’s mental and physical stability

title: Chief Minister Revanth Reddy slams BRS government for neglecting compassionate jobs, creating hurdles in development
content: The Chief Minister handed over appointment letters to 922 candidates, including over 500 who were appointed under compassionate grounds

title: Trump Signs Order To Begin "Eliminating" US Education Department
content: US President Donald Trump signed an order Thursday aimed at "eliminating" the Department of Education, a decades-old goal of the American right, which wants individual states to run schools free from the federal government.

title: Cash Found In Delhi High Court Judge's Home, Supreme Court Collegium Acts
content: The Supreme Court Collegium has decided that Justice Yashwant Verma will be transferred - from the Delhi High Court back to Allahabad - after unaccounted cash was found in his official bungalow last week.

title: US Judge Blocks Indian Researcher's Deportation Over Alleged Hamas Ties
content: A US judge ordered Thursday that an Indian researcher at a top American university not be removed from the country, following his arrest and threat of expulsion for alleged Hamas ties.

title: London's Heathrow Shuts Down Till Midnight After Fire Sparks Power Outage
content: London's Heathrow Airport has said it will shut down till midnight today after it experienced a "significant power outage".

title: Police Case Against Passport Agents After US Embassy Flags Visa Fraud
content: Delhi Police have filed a case against several visa and passport agents after the US embassy flagged a major fraud that allegedly "cheated" the US government to obtain visas for applicants by providing false information.

title: "Very Good Relationship, But...": Trump's Latest Tariff Comment On India
content: President Donald Trump said he has a "very good relationship" with India, but the "only problem" he has with the country is that it is "one of the highest tariffing nations in the world."

title: "No Sympathy For Sunita Williams Because...": Neil deGrasse Tyson Exclusive
content: Plastic cups and time to readjust to Earth's gravity - that is what Sunita Williams, whose eight-day mission to the International Space Station extended to a nine-month stay, will need to recover, astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson told NDTV.

title: Finland Is World's Happiest Country For 8th Year, India Stands At...
content: Released on the UN's International Day of Happiness, the report assesses the quality of life in over 140 countries based on resident feedback.

title: UP Professor, Accused Of Raping Students, Arrested After 72 Hours On The Run
content: Police in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj have arrested a 50-year-old Geography professor accused of sexually abusing his students - he allegedly filmed these acts and used these 59 videos to blackmail them.

title: "Separated In 2022": Chahal-Dhanashree Divorce Petition's Big Revelation
content: A family court on Thursday allowed the joint plea filed by cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal and his estranged wife seeking divorce by mutual consent.

title: KKR vs RCB IPL 2025 Opener Under Risk Of Abandonment In Kolkata. Here's Why
content: The IPL 2025 opener between Kolkata Knight Riders and Royal Challengers Bengaluru in Kolkata is under the threat of being abandoned.

title: National Anthem Plays, Nitish Kumar Talks, Laughs, Fidgets At Sports Meet
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar came under opposition attack again after he was caught on camera laughing and talking during the national anthem at a sports event in Patna today.

title: Musk To Be Briefed On Top-Secret US Plan For Potential War With China: Report
content: Access to the closely guarded military plan would mark a sharp expansion of Elon Musk's role as a Donald Trump adviser who has spearheaded efforts to cut US government spending.

title: "48 MLAs Honey Trapped": Targeted Karnataka Minister Calls For Probe
content: The Karnataka minister targetted with a failed honey trap said today not just him, but 48 MLAs have been targeted this way over the last 20 years. KN Rajanna, known to be close to Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, was targeted twice,

title: "Regret Moving Out Of Noida": Corporate Employee Lists Issues With Bengaluru
content: Bengaluru, the Silicon Valley of India, continues to attract IT professionals from across the country. But not everyone finds the city a perfect fit.

title: What Is Dark Energy? The Mystery Behind The Expanding Universe
content: Dark energy makes up roughly 70 percent of the universe, yet we know nothing about it. Around 25 percent of the universe is the equally mysterious dark matter, leaving just five percent for everything that we can see and touch.

title: US judge blocks deportation of Indian researcher at Georgetown university
content: A US federal judge blocked the deportation of Badar Khan Suri, an Indian-origin academic at Georgetown University, detained over alleged Hamas connections. Legal representatives argued the arrest aimed to suppress his speech supporting Palestinian rights. Georgetown confirmed Suri's valid visa and peacebuilding research.

title: Ascetic, who claimed Uttarakhand CM is of Nepali origin, held in land fraud case
content: Swami Dineshanand Bharti was arrested by Roorkee police for his alleged involvement in a land fraud case. The arrest has stirred public speculation, considering his recent controversial remarks about CM Dhami's Nepali origin, suggesting possible political motives behind the timing.

title: Last IPL hurrah for Dhoni, Rohit, Virat?
content: This IPL season might be the last for cricket legends like Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni besides seasoned performers like Faf Du Plessis and Sunil Narine. While they have all shown glimpses of their impressive form, age and past injuries suggest their IPL careers are nearing an end.

title: 'Fraudulent info, misrepresentations': How US embassy detected visa fraud by agents
content: Delhi Police have filed a case against 31 individuals accused of operating a visa fraud racket, following a complaint from the US embassy. The accused, including agents and applicants, allegedly forged documents to obtain US visas between May and August 2024. Further investigations are ongoing.

title: JioHotStar makes an 'IPL 2025 request' to Jio, Airtel &Voda as days of 'Free' IPL over
content: JioStar is planning to partner with telecom giants Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel, and Vodafone Idea to bundle IPL streaming subscriptions with their data plans for reaching over 1 billion viewers. This initiative aims to boost viewership and data consumption, crucial for JioStar's revenue targets, especially with IPL content behind a paywall.

title: What would an all-star IPL XI look like
content: TOI selects an all-star IPL XI as the tournament turns 18, featuring legends like Rohit Sharma, Chris Gayle, and MS Dhoni as captain and wicket-keeper. The team showcases players known for their remarkable performances, versatility and significant contributions to IPL history.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex opens over 100 points down; Nifty50 near 23,150
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Friday. While BSE Sensex was down over 100 points, Nifty50 was near 23,150.

title: Rahul Gandhi summoned by court over ‘fight against Indian state’ remark
content: Rahul Gandhi has been summoned by the Sambhal district court over his statement alleging that Congress is fighting against the Indian State. The remarks, made during the inauguration of Congress's new headquarters, triggered legal actions and political backlash. Gandhi faces charges in Guwahati for inciting unrest, while BJP leaders accused him of undermining India's sovereignty.

title: Ben Stiller, Paul McCartney, 400-plus stars urge US to act against Google, OpenAI
content: Over 400 Hollywood celebrities, including Ben Stiller and Mark Ruffalo, have opposed the Trump administration's consideration of AI-related copyright changes. They argue that weakening copyright protections for AI training undermines the creative industries, which support millions of jobs and contribute significantly to the economy.

title: Viral: Bill Gates, Sachin share India's best sandwich and we are drooling
content: Bill Gates recently visited India, admiring its innovation and problem-solving spirit. He shared memorable moments with cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar over vada pav and with a local tea seller, illustrating his appreciation for India's creativity and vibrant street food culture.

title: Heart health matters: Join TOI's Medithon for expert insights
content: Heart diseases are becoming more prevalent due to lifestyle choices and genetic factors. Prevention through healthy habits, regular check-ups, and awareness is crucial. The Times of India will host a medithon on March 21 with top cardiologists discussing heart disease risks and prevention. Sessions will cover managing heart diseases and specific impacts on youngsters and women.

title: Nvidia CEO calls China’s 'security threat' its top tech firm
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang praised Huawei's advancements in AI, labeling them as a major technological force in China despite US sanctions. He criticized the US approach to restricting Huawei. Huang also denied involvement in discussions about a consortium to invest in Intel’s factories alongside TSMC, Broadcom, and AMD.

title: 25 Indians on death row in UAE, over 10k nationals in foreign prisons: Govt
content: The number of Indian nationals awarded a death sentence in the UAE stands at 25. Minister of State for External Affairs, Kirti Vardhan Singh, confirmed this in Parliament. The Indian government prioritizes the safety of its nationals abroad and provides assistance to those sentenced. There are 10,152 Indian prisoners in foreign jails including those awaiting capital punishment.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research recommends Zydus Lifesciences and National Aluminium stocks for today. It expects Nifty to move towards 23,500 levels and sees Bank Nifty heading to 50,600.

title: Uncertainty looms over Karnataka bandh on March 22 as key groups remain undecided
content: On February 28, ‘Kannada Okkuta,’ an umbrella body representing multiple pro-Kannada organisations, formally announced the bandh, scheduled from 6 am to 6 pm.

title: Bihar Minister says RJD leader was involved in son’s kidnapping in 2007
content: The RJD leader had met him with a ransom demand but Nitish Kumar helped bring his son back, says BJP’s Santosh Kumar Singh; leaders trade blame, accusing each other over law and order issues

title: Tiruchi Corporation steps up efforts to ramp up revenue mobilisation
content: The total tax revenue has surpassed 50%. However, vacant land tax, water charges, non-tax revenue, and underground drainage (UGD) charges remain low, prompting further action in these areas

title: KFPA files defamation case against Jayan Cherthala
content: The KFPA filed the case after Mr. Jayan failed to respond to its February 2025 notice, which asked him to retract his claim that the producers’ body had yet to repay part of the financial support extended by the association of actors.

title: Traffic curbs in Hyderabad for Hazrat Ali procession on Friday
content: Traffic restrictions will be in place from 2 p.m. to 8 p.m. for the Hazrat Ali procession; commuters are advised to take alternate routes

title: IPL: Shardul set to replace Mohsin at LSG; Mayank remains 50-50
content: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) are set to sign Shardul Thakur after an ACL injury ruled out Mohsin Khan for the 2025 IPL season. With several key seamers recovering, Thakur's experience will be crucial. Mentor Zaheer Khan emphasized a dynamic approach to managing player injuries.

title: Trump signs order to 'dismantle' department of education
content: President Donald Trump signed an executive order to begin dismantling the US Department of Education, aiming to return education authority to the states. The order, which faces significant legal and logistical hurdles, may impact public education, student loans, and federal grants.

title: 'Lack of trust': Netanyahu fires internal security agency chief Ronen Bar
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dismissed Shin Bet chief Ronen Bar citing an ongoing lack of trust and tensions over judicial reforms and security issues. Bar's tenure was further marred by a Hamas attack and an internal report's acknowledgment of security failures.

title: Pakistan army captain, 10 terrorists killed in encounter in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
content: At least 10 terrorists and an army captain in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa's Dera Ismail Khan district were killed in a military encounter. The operation was launched following intelligence reports of terrorist presence. Pakistan's military seized a large cache of ammunition. This follows a surge in terror attacks since the Taliban's takeover of Afghanistan in 2021.

title: Bid to defame me: Aaditya Thackeray; Uddhav says son has no link to Disha case
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) leaders Aaditya and Uddhav Thackeray responded to allegations over Disha Salian's death case, refuting any connection and accusing the BJP of using the issue for political gain. Uddhav criticized BJP for ignoring farmers' issues, while Aaditya emphasized focusing on real problems and questioned BJP's unfulfilled promises.

title: DK Metcalf sends Seahawks a blunt message after trade to Steelers
content: DK Metcalf, now a Pittsburgh Steeler, has taken a parting shot at the Seahawks, declaring that 'the grass is greener on the other side.' Seattle's ongoing quarterback issues and inconsistent offensive identity likely contributed to his departure. The Steelers, with Metcalf and George Pickens, aim to build a championship offense, raising questions about Seattle's decision to trade him.

title: Doxxed, Detained, Deported: Campus dissent faces a Trumped-up crackdown
content: Foreign students and scholars in the US face growing fear due to actions like doxxing and deportation over their criticism of Trump policies. Incidents involving French and Middle Eastern academics highlight the crackdown, with campus administrations under pressure. Right-wing activists and pro-Israel groups are escalating conflicts, causing anxiety in the academic community.

title: A new ‘China Shock’ is destroying jobs worldwide – with India in crosshairs
content: US President Trump is intensifying his trade war, imposing tariffs on India from April 2 for what he claims are unfair duties on US goods. While targeting China’s economic expansion, the resulting oversupply of cheap Chinese products is harming local industries globally. Countries like India are considering tariff reductions to avert a full-scale trade war.

title: 'Badar Luck': Indian scholar faces deportation over Hamas links
content: US immigration authorities have detained Indian researcher Badar Khan Suri from Georgetown University for alleged pro-Hamas activism, purportedly violating visa terms. Suri, with critical views on Israeli actions in Gaza, faces deportation. Georgetown University maintains Suri’s innocence and supports open inquiry. Suri’s lawyer decries the detention, emphasizing Suri's focus on peace-building.

title: 'Cried throughout, didn't eat food': How 'killer' Meerut wife spent 1st night in prison
content: Muskan Rastogi, along with her lover Sahil Shukla, has been accused of murdering and dismembering her husband, Saurabh Rajput, whose body was found encased in cement. Both accused are in judicial custody as investigations continue, revealing a premeditated crime stemming from their rekindled relationship.

title: Dickie V makes his March Madness picks for every game
content: the big dance is here, and I'm ready to break it down, Dickie V style! we've got PTPers (prime time performers), diaper dandies and championship-caliber coaching ready to take the court .

title: Men's NCAA tournament: Live updates, highlights, analysis from Day 1
content: every opening-day game of the men's 2025 NCAA tournament has officially tipped off . consider this your guide to all the major highlights and results, along with reactions and on-site reporting from ESPN writers across the country . the red storm opened the last half on a 17-5 run and never looked back .

title: Is JuJu Watkins the best player in the women’s NCAA tournament? We rank the top 25
